ofx:section.ofx:title: Base Installation (Debian Wheezy)
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Your installation starts with the boot menu, select "install" for the command-line version. Click language selection and choose "English - English" for your base installation and continue by selecting your current country. The next step is to install the keyboard layout, which is "en_US.UTF-8". This step is required to ensure that your keyboard is working properly. In order to have a key map select: "actual keyboard mapping".

l:item.ofx:paragraph: Select a valid hostname first (e.g. "database"). This step is necessary to identify your system in your Local Area Network (LAN).
Set a secure root password. Repeat it twice and make sure that it contains at least 10 characters, numbers and additional characters.
Create an account to work with, this is your login. For example "Developer" with password "dev".

ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Network Time Protocol (NTP) is a networking protocol for clock synchronisation between computer systems. It may fail, if no Internet connection is established.

ofx:section.ofx:title: Partition Disks
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph:
The installation continues with the partition method. Disk partitioning is the act of dividing a hard disk drive (HDD) into multiple logical storage units referred to as partitions, to treat one physical disk drive as if it were multiple disks, so that a different file system can be used on each partition. The total data storage space of a PC HDD can contain at most four primary partitions, or alternatively three primary partitions and an extended partition. A primary partition contains one file system.
Please select "Guided - use entire disk". Now select your HDD and choose "All files in one partition" and go on. After this move to "finish partitioning" and write the changes to disk. Check your configuration and confirm it.

ofx:section.ofx:title: Package Manager (Mirror)
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph:
A package manager is a collection of software tools that automates the process of installing, upgrading, configuring, and removing software packages for a computer's operating system.
Select your country (or a country with good connection to). Choose a mirror, for example "ftp.(your country).debian.org/debian/". If there is a proxy server in your domain, add the proxy server information and continue. No participation in package usage survey.

ofx:section.ofx:title: Software Selection
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: All available software packages can be de-selected. This ensures that the installation will only have a minimal number of packages and modules available. This minimises the risks of errors or faulty configurations and facilitates future upgrade procedures. Press TAB and select CONTINUE. All necessary packages will be installed manually.

ofx:section.ofx:title: Finishing Installation
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Install GRUB boot loader to the master boot record. This step is necessary to select the operating system after booting your system. Press YES. The base installation of debian is now ready.
